text: ['3.2.3  Export prohibitions, authorizations and licensing', '3.99.  The Dominican Republic imposes export prohibitions and requires permits or authorizations for a limited number of products.', '3.100.  The list of products which may not be exported include amber, larimar and tortoise-shell (Table 3.12).', 'Table 3.12 List of prohibited exports', 'Product Human blood and blood products Amber in its natural state Tortoise-shell Amber, larimar, and similar minerals, not worked', 'Source:   WTO Secretariat.', 'Legal framework Law No. 56 Law No. 165 Law No. 95 Decree No. 13-87', 'Date of enactment 28 October 1974 26 May 1967 16 January 1967 7 January 1987', '3.101.  In  addition  to  the  permits  issued  for  sanitary  or  phytosanitary  reasons,  the  authorities have  indicated  that  the  Dominican  Republic  requires  permits  for  the  export  of  fresh  fruit, oriental vegetables and sugar. Exporters of fresh fruit and oriental vegetables must be registered with the DSV in the Ministry of Agriculture162, and be in possession of an authorization under the Oriental  Vegetables,  Fresh  Fruit  and Related  Products  for  Export  Programme  (PROVOFEX)  within this Department.163 Exporters of sugar and molasses must register their sales contracts and obtain an export permit from INAZUCAR.164 These are valid for 30 days and cover only one transaction.165', '155 Article 4 of Law No. 110-13 of 8 August 2013, on Trade and Export of Ferrous and Non-Ferrous Metal', 'Waste, Scrap Metal, and Waste of Copper, Aluminium, etc., and Article 4 of its implementing Regulations issued by Decree No. 164-14 of 26 May 2014.', '156 Article 20 of the Regulations implementing Law No. 110-13, issued by Decree No. 164-14 of', '26 May 2014.', '157 Article 11 of Law No. 139-11. 158 Article 31 of Law No. 253-12 of 9 November 2012, amending Law No. 139-11. 159 Article 25 of Law No. 307-04 of 15 December 2004. 160 Article 342 of the Tax Code, last amended on 9 November 2012. 161 Article 366 of the Tax Code, last amended on 9 November 2012 162 Article 5 of Resolution No. 49-2005 of 6 October 2005. 163 In November 2014, PROVOFEX moved up to the category of National Directorate for the Export of', 'Vegetables, Fresh Fruit and Related Products (DINVOFEX) in the Ministry of Agriculture (Resolution No. 49-2014 of 5 November 2014).', '164 Article 18 of Law No. 618 of 1965 and amendments thereto. It was last amended on 8 January 1987', 'by Law No. 27.', '\x0cWT/TPR/S/319 • Dominican Republic', '- 71 -', '3.102.  An export permit issued by the Ministry of Public Health166 is also required for medicines and chemical substances and from SEMARNAT for plants and wild animals and their products.167 Export (marketing) of fishery products also requires a permit (Section 4.2).', '3.103.  Since  late  June 2011,  products  from  Dominican  free  zones  have  no  longer  required authorization from the CNZFE in order to be sold on the domestic market. Before they can be sold, however,  the  companies  concerned  must  simply  notify  the  Council  accordingly  and  submit  their declaration to the DGA in order to determine the duty to be paid.168']
